newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli soldier wounded in south Lebanon attack.
newsitem.headline: Israeli soldier wounded in south Lebanon attack.

text.p: An Israeli soldier was wounded on Monday in an explosion in south Lebanon, pro-Israeli militia sources said.
They said an explosion occurred near an Israeli patrol on the Houla-Marqaba road in the central sector of Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone.
The cause was not known and no group claimed responsibility for the attack.
On Sunday, one Israeli soldier was wounded in a Hizbollah rocket attack inside the zone.
The pro-Iranian Hizbollah (Party of God) is fighting to oust Israeli troops from the 15 km (nine-mile) wide buffer zone.
